channel.title: Running a private server
channel.description:
Hi guys, new post =)
I created a source for my server and my mate has tried it since his computer seems to run private servers, but when i try to run it, it never seems to work. Could this be due to the fact that im using a laptop, or my laptop is too rubbish?
*Rewritten* Some of you asked for more detail, so ill give some.
When you compile the server (correctly that is), it should come up in the compile logs that you have done in correctly, but mine doesn't.
Here's the compiler which has just compiled [IMG]http://i418.photobucket.com/albums/pp270/jonbon0/compiler.jpg[/img]
and this is the compile log... [IMG]http://i418.photobucket.com/albums/pp270/jonbon0/emptycompilelog.jpg[/img]
I have 1gb ram, 1.83ghz processor, 256mb graph card and i seem to run most things fine. Ive also read stormcutters TUT on how to make a server, and ive done it word for word. My classpaths and paths are CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%; and C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin; Im using jdk 1.6.0_06 because ive checked on my program files. Ive also checked my port forwarding and that seems to be working so does anybody know my problem? :confused:
I really need help so could anybody help me? :( THIS IS RS2 BY THE WAY :)
Thanks for reading,
Jonbon0 :P

item.title: Running a private server
item.dc:creator: @zerogordo zerogordo
item.description:
@zerogordo wrote:

It doesnt matter what source your using :S go to C:\programfiles\java

and when you see jdk1.6.0_0! replace ! with the number you see in the java folder for example jdk 6 u 3 is jdk1.6.0_03

Read full topic

item.title: Running a private server
item.dc:creator: @I3itcher I3itcher
item.description:
@I3itcher wrote:

hmm, which source are you using, if it is PkScap3 i could help…

Read full topic

item.title: Running a private server
item.dc:creator: @jonbon0 jonbon0
item.description:
@jonbon0 wrote:

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:5, topic:235950”]Make your own.
@Jonbon; Show me your compiler text, and then i’ll say if it’s meant to write to those logs?[/quote]

My compile is :COM06
echo :: Found JDK 1.6.0_06
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin
echo :: Results:
javac *.java
echo :: Done!
pause
goto main

MoparScaperDude:

Apparently he wants it to write logs =/

and no, i don’t, all i want to find out is if its correct, because my server doesn’t work!

Read full topic

item.description:
@jonbon0 wrote:

Hi guys, new post =)

I created a source for my server and my mate has tried it since his computer seems to run private servers, but when i try to run it, it never seems to work. Could this be due to the fact that im using a laptop, or my laptop is too rubbish?

Rewritten Some of you asked for more detail, so ill give some.

When you compile the server (correctly that is), it should come up in the compile logs that you have done in correctly, but mine doesn’t.

Here’s the compiler which has just compiled

compiler.jpg720×450

and this is the compile log…

I have 1gb ram, 1.83ghz processor, 256mb graph card and i seem to run most things fine.
Ive also read stormcutters TUT on how to make a server, and ive done it word for word.
